replies.body:
I really like hearing about the thought that goes into series like Battlecast, Mecha and PROJECT, especially since Battlecast is one of my favourites. I always get very distinct feelings from seeing these three, and it's good because though they all have that technologically advanced feel, they're all unique.
I always see Battlecast as heavy, iron, industrial, burning machines of destruction. Apocalyptic mayhem and crumbling cities with fire and explosions.
Mecha is sharp edges and cool metal with lots of colourful energy effects. Suits of power used to take personal grudges to a behemoth scale and likely create a few craters in the land.
PROJECT immediately makes me think towering sleek metal skyscrapers, neon lights through the rain, shiny chrome and secretive ACCESS DENIED messages. Like a secret organisation is watching you over your shoulder.

Now, lets pit them against each other!

great comparison summary between the three types of skins,i fully agree..

what skin to throw my cashish at first ..uugh choices
How come no project yasuo icon? :(

what? seriously! do you need an icon for everything nowadays?

icons should be something that coin cannot provide

workhard/playhard=reward

coining it is easy yup
but there needs to be some remnant of earning your deserved icon/reward

otherwise whats the point of player skill
it makes it redundant

So basically a guy made a really bad ass skin, but you guys had to make it s**t so you didn't have to put in as much effort in the rest of the skins. They're a disappointment. So many things could've been done and you make them all boring. The only reason I've bought them is for their op effects.

You made Zeds ult almost f*ing invisible and muted. Lucians abilities are harder to dodge aswel as the rest of the champs.

Another thing: chromas. Literally you guys choose 3 colours (even if the colours are stupid like a blue dragonslayer that isn't much different from the original.) Have you guys had a proper look at the bard chromas? Vayne? Out of all badass colours you made Vayne into a slightly lighter blue, red (most dominant/badass looking) and a leaf. Bulbasaur if you will.
You're right about the Chromas but I think they did a great on the project skins. They just need another sliver of story, you know? Something to go with the skins to spice things up abit...
I can agree on no part besides about Chromas, they are ugly and sick as hell.

I find that their definition of PROJECT is a little cluttered and that it hides what it truly is, i.e. Cyberpunk. 

The Mecha lines are focused on big, hulking machines and the Battlecast line is all about combustion. 

The PROJECT lines are clearly organic beings augmented with machinery, just as in Cyberpunk.
